intro: Borinda nujiangensis, commonly known as the Yunnan borinda, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions with high humidity and partial shade. Its flowers are usually pale pink or white, and it produces small, round berries. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
